Description: Gold ear-ring; plain wire hoop decorated with three sets of incised circles; at one end is a loop into which the thin end of the ring is passed; above the loop is soldered a small convex disc with a beaded wire border; from the ring hangs a pendant rod with a gold bead with a globule at its end.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: Similar in type to 1894,11-1.295. Four earrings of this type are mentioned in the register and attributed to this tomb (GR 1894,11-1.355-358). Three are not currently identifiable in the collection.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2524)
Laffineur et al. 1986 / Amathonte III. Testimonia 3. L'Orfèvrerie. Scarabées, scaraboïdes et cônes. La coupe en argent du British Museum (No. 514, p. 79)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 121, Tomb 155 (?))
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces
